I Tried Google, But They All Are ******* Bad :mad: If Anyone Can Give Me A Link To A Good Tut It Would Be Highly Aprecited :rolleyes:
Also It Would Be Helpful If You Anwser My Other Question, look for my other topic......

item.title: How Do I Make A Decent Contact Form?
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

[quote=“N00b1, post:4, topic:87936”]the html just make it how you like it

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<title>contact us</title>
</head>
<body>
<div align="center">
  <form method='post' action="contactus.php">
    <p><font face="Verdana" size="1"><strong><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">Your name?</font></strong><font color="#FF0000" face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><strong>*</strong></font></font><font size="1" face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><strong>  </strong></font>
      <input type="text" name="name" size="40" />
    </p>
    <p> <font face="Verdana" size="1"><b>Your e-mail address?<font color="#FF0000">*</font></b></font>
      <input type="text" name="email" size="40" />
    </p>
    <p><font size="1" face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><strong>Subject?
      <input name="sub" type="text" size="40" />
      </strong></font></p>
    <p><font face="Verdana" size="1"><b>Message<font color="#FF0000">*</font></b></font></p>
    <p>
      <textarea name="message" rows="8" cols="45"></textarea>
    </p>
    <p>
      <input type="submit" name="submit" value="Submit" />
    </p>
  </form>
</div>
</body>
</html>

the php should work may need a little work as i haven’t tested out the send mail but it seems ok

[php]

<?php if(isset($_POST['submit'])) { $errors = 0; $errorlist = ""; $date = date("l, F j, Y, g:i a"); $name = $_POST['name']; $email = $_POST['email']; $sub = $_POST['sub']; $mess = $_POST['message']; if ($name == "" ){ $errors++; $errorlist .= "Name field is required.
"; } elseif ($email == "" ){ $errors++; $errorlist .= "email field is required.
"; } elseif ($sub == "" ){ $errors++; $errorlist .= "subject field is required.
"; } elseif ($message == "" ){ $errors++; $errorlist .= "message field is required.
"; } if (errors > 0) { echo "$errorlist"; die(); } else { $message = "this email was sent from your domail on $date by $name who wrote this $mess"; mail("chris@rs2legendz.com", $sub, $message); } } ?>

[/php]

again another quick one let me know if it works should :S[/quote]

search around first…

made it in like 5 mins whiles having food

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Remember that MAILTO isn’t a proper contact form. It’s a lazy and horrible way of making a contact form. There are a few free scripts out there that will make it be able to e-mail you the information.
